alert.note: Alert for Boone; Logan; Mingo; Northwest Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 6:58PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mingo, northwestern Raleigh, Logan, northwestern Wyoming and southeastern Boone Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 657 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Man, or 8 miles south of Logan, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Logan, Pineville, Oceana, Man, Hanover, R.d. Bailey Lake, Gilbert Creek, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Bald Knob, Mallory, Amherstdale-Robinette, Wharton, Hinch, Holden, Gilbert, West Logan, Mount Gay, Chauncey, Coal Mountain and Bruno. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 24 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Logan; Mingo; Northwest Raleigh; Wyoming
